articles.title: UK rebukes China for supporting Argentina’s Falklands claim
articles.description: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said in a tweet that the United Kingdom "completely" rejected "any questions over sovereignty of the Falklands."
articles.content:
Britain on Monday firmly rejected a statement from China that affirmed Beijing’s support for Argentina’s claim to the Falkland Islands, as relations between London and Asia’s leading power remain strained.

articles.title: Liz Truss says Falklands are part of 'British family', as China backs Argentina's claim over islands after meeting during Beijing Olympics
articles.description: China's president Xi meets with Alberto Fernandez, the president of Argentina, in Beijing, and they agree on an accord in which China reasserts its support for Argentina's claim to the Falklands, while Mr Fernandez backs Mr Jingping's one-China policy, which claims Taiwan as its own.
articles.content:
The Falklands are "part of the British family", according to Liz Truss, after China backed Argentina's claims over the south Atlantic islands.

articles.title: Kids Here Have More Freedom to Be Themselves
articles.description: The author and her family moved from Brooklyn to a small town in Argentina. The benefits have been immeasurable, and they don't plan on moving back.
articles.content:
I love raising my American kids in Argentina because there aren't as many rules for them.
Kids keep themselves occupied and have more independence.
Kids are fully integrated into society, which means parents have more support, too.
